title: Here is a list of 20 influential and recent articles on retrieval-based language models up to 2023. These articles cover a range of topics, including the development, evaluation, and application of retrieval-based models in natural language processing
**"Dense Passage Retrieval for Open-Domain Question Answering"** - Karpukhin et al
Retrieval-Augmented Language Model Pre-Training"** - Guu et al
Retrieval-Augmented Generation for Knowledge-Intensive NLP Tasks"**
Unsupervised Dense Information Retrieval with Contrastive Learning"** - Izacard et al
Efficient and Effective Passage Search via Contextualized Late Interaction over BERT"**
**"T5: Exploring the Limits of Transfer Learning with a Unified Text-to-Text Transformer"**
**"FiD: A Simple Method for Improving Retrieval-Based Question Answering"**
**"Learning to Retrieve Passages without Supervision"** - Lee et al

author.literal: **"Dense Retrieval as Generative Query Reformulation"** - Mao et al.

title: **"Retriever-Reader Interaction for Scalable Open-Domain Question Answering"** - Xiong et al
**"Beyond a Pre-Trained Language Model: A Case Study on Open-Domain Question Answering"**
**"Unsupervised Dense Retrieval with Contrastive Learning"** - Gao and Callan
**"Pre-trained Language Models for Information Retrieval: A Brief Review"**
**"Learning Dense Representations for Retrieval via Targeted Weak Supervision"**

author.literal: **"Multi-Stage Document Ranking with BERT"** - Nogueira et al.

title: **"Anserini: Reproducible Ranking Baselines Using Lucene"** - Yang et al
**"Improving Passage Retrieval with Zero-Shot Question Generation"** - Puri et al
**"Efficient Passage Retrieval with Hashing for Open-Domain Question Answering"** - Zhang et al

author.literal: **"A Survey on Retrieval-Augmented Generation"** - Thakur et al.

title: **"Revisiting Few-shot Learning for Open-Domain Question Answering"** - Min et al
These articles provide a comprehensive overview of the advancements in retrieval-based language models, their applications, and the methodologies used to improve their performance
